summary.originalText: Damn...what a movie...paisa wasool.. and salute to our unknown men who protect our nation from evil eyes.

originalText.plaidHtml: Acting top-notch, direction top notch, story top notch, and liberal gang ka pakka jhelega....ye movie dekh ke....btw full paisa wasool and emotional ride. Must watch but only for adults. All cast acting was absolute masterpiece, such raw movie should be promoted based real life, instead of large than life spy movies.

summary.originalText: Drama That Echoes, Action That Explodes

originalText.plaidHtml: Dhurandhar is pure entertainment with a strong story. The director has done a fantastic job of telling a complex story in a way that is easy to follow. The actors brought their characters to life-especially the leads, who carried the emotions perfectly. Action, drama, and suspense are all balanced so well that you don't get overwhelmed. The supporting cast also did a brilliant job adding depth. Every fight, chase, and emotional moment felt real. You finish the movie feeling satisfied and amazed by the director's vision.

Excitement and thrill at next level. 3.5hrs flim but not a single point when it fill boring. Salute to director for showing such a great movie and showcasing reality about pakistan actually they are worse than this. In bollywood, there are very less such movies. Everyone should watch it once. Needs to go again.

Every frame of this film is meticulously crafted, pulling you into a world that feels both immense and intimate. The lead delivers a powerhouse performance, effortlessly balancing vulnerability with raw intensity. Action sequences are choreographed with precision, each fight carrying narrative weight rather than mere spectacle. The screenplay intertwines personal stakes with high-octane suspense, making every twist feel earned. The cinematography captures both grandeur and minute detail, while the sound design amplifies tension in ways that are thrilling yet subtle. Supporting characters are layered and memorable, contributing to the narrative's richness. The political and criminal undercurrents feel authentic, grounding the story in a believable reality. By the climax, the tension is almost unbearable, but the payoff is profoundly satisfying, leaving a lasting impression of cinema that is both intelligent and heart-pounding.

Watched Dhurandhar yesterday... What a movie!!!

Pure goosebumps Superb Direction... Not a single dull moment. Kept us glued to the the seat.. Not even giving chance to buy popcorn or chit chat with friends... The background score hits hard, and the acting, direction, music, songs...everything just falls perfectly into place Standout Performances by Ranveer, Akshay, Sanjay and..... Everyone....

An absolute must-watch.

summary.originalText: A Sharp, Realistic Thriller That Hits Hard

originalText.plaidHtml: Dhurandhar is a gripping and tightly-made thriller that keeps you hooked from start to finish. The storytelling feels raw and grounded, backed by strong performances from the cast. The pacing is steady, the emotional moments land well, and the film balances realism with entertainment without going overboard. A solid watch that leaves a lasting impact.

Kudos to the director who presented the movie in a gripping and amazing manner.

Ranveer Singh, you nailed it in the movie.

Thanks for giving such kind of movies to audience, really enjoyed it.

Arjun rampal and Akshay Khanna you guys are great.

I liked the very first scene of the movie where Madhavan delivers deadly look to the terrorists.

Dhurandhar is unapologetically real. It is a move away from the standard entertainment formula Indian Spy movies are based on. At no stage you would feel a song or a scene is forcefit into the movie, which is unlike Bollywood. The length of the movie is also not felt as it keeps you hooked throughout.

Must watch!

summary.originalText: Dhurandhar Is a Must-Watch - Don't Let the Noise Fool You

originalText.plaidHtml:
If you're on the fence because of a few negative reviews, ignore them and experience Dhurandhar yourself. A lot of the criticism floating around seems more reactionary than thoughtful - the kind that pops up whenever a film speaks boldly or pushes uncomfortable truths. That's exactly why it deserves to be seen.

This movie has genuine craft, energy, and clarity in its storytelling. Instead of getting influenced by people who might be threatened by open expression or strong perspectives, trust your own eyes. Watch it, think about it, and decide for yourself.

Dhurandhar rewards anyone who approaches it with an open mind - and honestly, it's too good to miss.

summary.originalText: THe best Bollywood movie so far

originalText.plaidHtml:
Our generation's best Bollywood movie is Dhurandhar for sure.

The detailing is next level. Every character is so close to reality. Hats off to acting and makeup. The soundtracks are just amazing, Sashwat Sachdev, you beauty. And the way every character shines out. Man, I really hated a few of them even tho I knew it's just acting. But the acting and character grip by every actor is so real it doesn't feel real.

3 hours 30 minutes runtime and not even one boring minute. Dhurandhar is a gripping movie fr! Ranveer Singh, R. Madhavan Sanjay Dutt were brilliant in their roles. Akshaye Khanna... I don't have words to describe the work of this man. Good to see Saumya Tandon back on the big screen. Aditya Dhar has done a great job. Thank you for this film. And yes he has shown that those mujras and unnecessary robotics and Pak sympathizing isn't needed to make a good spy movie. Rakesh Bedi Sir's presence gave the film that humor and he outperformed himself in every scene. Sara Arjun did a fantastic job as well! Danish Pandor has given justice to his role. Overall, the movie is a must watch. And salute to all those unknown men who are protecting the nation!

Great screenplay, amazing music, felt like bollywood is back again, the way movie has been told, each scene js amazing, only wish to see R. Madhavn & sanjay dutt more , Aditya dhar you are in the favourite list now. Fabulous casting extra points for that...will definitely watch part 2 as well.. great Work!!

Movie reveals the Real face of terrorism in Pakistan and life of a Indian spy in Pakistan. Movie takes care of minute details, reveal pak politics and attacks by Pak terrorist in India,26/11. Acting of Akshay Khanna is fabulous in his role as Rahman Dakait. Sanjay dutt is also excellent in his role. Ranveer singh nailed the character of spy.

Hats off to the whole team who pulled this off.. Never before has a spy thriller been based on true events been made by Indian cinema.. The true face of the Pakistanis has been exposed in this bold movie. Aditya Dhar never disappoints. And talk about comebacks! Boy Mr. KHANNAA!! Love it!! You absolutely nailed your role.

It's raw and gritty, and the film uses lots of actual real-life clips and audio that make everything feel incredibly authentic. The way the scenes are stitched together gives a strong sense of realism. What really stands out is how it captures the spirit and resilience of our people without turning it into over-the-top drama. It shows the ground reality with honesty and still leaves you feeling proud of the courage and strength that define this country. Overall, a powerful and engaging watch.

summary.originalText: Must Watch For Every Indian and Baloch

originalText.plaidHtml:
This is not a movie, it's a documentary as it has all the facts. Lesser use of creative freedom, no appeasement, pure cinema with eye opening truth. Good music, excellent cinematography and marvelous acting. Salute to unsung heroes of India who are known as UNKNOWN MEN, this movie is an honest tribute to you all
Thank you Aditya Dhar and team for being honest to the script. Eagerly waiting for DHURANDHAR PART TWO...

The film's strength lies in its ability to balance high-octane action with deep emotional resonance. The lead actor commands the screen, while the ensemble cast adds depth and nuance. Fight scenes and chases are tense and visually striking. The director demonstrates precise control over pacing and tone, making the story both engaging and thought-provoking, culminating in a climax that's powerful and satisfying.

Dhurandhar is a powerful, engaging, and thoroughly entertaining film that succeeds in delivering a complete cinematic experience. From the very beginning, the movie establishes a strong grip over the audience with its intense tone, sharp storytelling, and confident direction. It does not waste time in unnecessary build-up and quickly draws viewers into its world.

The biggest strength of Dhurandhar lies in its lead performance. The protagonist dominates the screen with a perfect balance of raw aggression and emotional depth. His body language, dialogue delivery, and screen presence elevate the character and make it memorable. This is not just loud heroism; it is grounded, convincing, and impactful. The supporting cast complements the lead well, each character having a clear purpose and contributing meaningfully to the narrative.

The direction deserves special appreciation. The filmmaker maintains a tight grip on the storyline, ensuring that every scene pushes the plot forward. There are no unnecessary distractions, and the pacing remains largely consistent. The film smartly balances action and emotion, preventing it from becoming either too chaotic or overly sentimental.

Action sequences are well-choreographed and realistic, focusing more on intensity than exaggerated stunts. These scenes feel earned and serve the story rather than existing merely for visual spectacle. The background score is another major highlight-it enhances tension, amplifies emotions, and adds weight to key moments, making several scenes truly goosebump-worthy.

Emotionally, Dhurandhar strikes the right notes. The struggles, motivations, and conflicts of the characters feel relatable, which helps the audience connect on a deeper level. The dialogues are sharp and impactful, with several lines leaving a lasting impression.

Visually, the film is well-crafted with strong cinematography that complements the gritty tone of the story. The overall production quality reflects sincerity and effort, adding to the film's immersive experience.

In conclusion, Dhurandhar is a well-made, hard-hitting entertainer that blends action, emotion, and strong performances effectively. It caters to mass audiences while retaining substance, making it a paisa-vasool film and a must-watch for anyone who enjoys intense, character-driven cinema.

Dhurandhar (2025) is a gripping spy action thriller that earns its 8/10 rating by delivering a tense, immersive experience filled with layered performances, masterful direction, and a politically charged narrative that demands attention from start to finish. Story and DirectionThe film, directed by Aditya Dhar, follows Hamza (Ranveer Singh), a young RAW agent thrust into a covert operation in Karachi's dangerous Lyari town. The story traces the intricate nexus of crime, politics, and terror, with Dhar's direction ensuring every sequence-whether action-packed or contemplative-feels vital and purposeful. The pacing builds gradually, rewarding patience with a payoff that is both emotionally and narratively satisfying. PerformancesRanveer Singh delivers arguably the best performance of his career, balancing intensity, vulnerability, and moral complexity. Akshaye Khanna stands out with a compelling portrayal, while the supporting cast adds depth and authenticity to the film's criminal ecosystem. The ensemble's chemistry and commitment elevate the storytelling, making the world feel lived-in and believable. Cinematography and SoundVikash Nowlakha's cinematography plunges viewers into the gritty alleys of Lyari, capturing both the chaos and intimacy of the setting. The background score by Shashwat Sachdev is a pulsating heartbeat that maintains tension throughout, enhancing the film's immersive quality. Every shot is meticulously crafted, setting a new benchmark for the genre. Strengths and WeaknessesDhurandhar excels in its blend of action, suspense, and political intrigue, with adrenaline-pumping set pieces balanced by quieter, character-driven moments. The film's only minor flaw is its long runtime, which some may find cumbersome, but every minute is justified by ambitious world-building and layered storytelling. The narrative's climax is a masterclass in suspense, leaving audiences eager for the sequel. Final VerdictDhurandhar is a no-brainer for fans of action thrillers and political dramas. With powerhouse performances, technical brilliance, and a story that resonates long after the credits roll, it stands as one of Bollywood's strongest releases of 2025.

Such an amazing movie, I was shocked to see that bollywood can be this good, from the color grading to tone of the movie to the soundtracks and the story, everything is perfectly blended. Absolute cinematic experience in theatre. You won't feel the long runtime of the movie, it keeps you that hooked. Can't wait for part-2.

The movie portrays reality but blends it with a fair amount of Bollywood-style masala, which actually works in its favour most of the time. The director has set the tone brilliantly, ensuring that the film maintains a balance between serious moments and commercial entertainment. Although some dialogues come across as slightly cringe-worthy, they are still far better than what we usually get from big franchise films like the YRF Spy Universe. At least here, the lines feel more grounded and contribute to the overall mood of the story rather than trying too hard to sound "cool."

The music in the film is surprisingly enjoyable. The songs are catchy, well-placed, and enhance the emotional beats without feeling forced. The background score also complements the intensity and keeps the audience engaged. Acting-wise, the cast delivers solid performances across the board. A special mention definitely goes to Akshaye Khanna, Ranveer, and R. Madhavan, who stand out with their impressive and compelling portrayals. Each of them brings depth and nuance to their character, making their scenes some of the most memorable in the entire film.

What makes the movie even more appealing is that the screen time doesn't feel dragged. Despite its length, the pacing is well-managed, and I found myself genuinely enjoying the experience throughout. There were hardly any moments where I felt the narrative slowed down unnecessarily. Whether it was due to the performances, the music, or the overall energy of the film, it kept me invested from start to finish.

Overall, the movie succeeds in delivering an entertaining and engaging cinematic experience. It may not be perfect, but it offers enough compelling moments, strong performances, and enjoyable music to make it worth watching.

summary.originalText: A one of the most most and most best film of my life

originalText.plaidHtml:
Dhurandhar (2025) redefines Indian spy thrillers with its unflinching gaze into the shadows of terror. Directed by Aditya Dhar, the film plunges viewers into Operation Dhurandhar, where Ranveer Singh's Hamza Ali Mazari-a fierce Intelligence Bureau operative-infiltrates Karachi's brutal Lyari ganglands. Inspired by real events like the Kandahar hijacking and 26/11 attacks, Hamza poses as a local gangster to dismantle terror networks linked to Pakistan's underworld and ISI, navigating savage rivalries, betrayals, and a forbidden romance with Elina (Sara Arjun).

Ranveer Singh delivers his career-best performance, feral and layered, blending raw intensity with haunting vulnerability as Hamza grapples with moral dilemmas and personal ghosts. Akshaye Khanna's chilling Rehman Dakait exudes menace, while R. Madhavan's steely IB Director Ajay Sanyal and Sanjay Dutt's commanding presence elevate the ensemble. Arjun Rampal adds quiet intimidation. Dhar masterfully balances a deliberate slow-burn buildup-mapping crime-politics-terror nexuses-with explosive action in the 214-minute runtime, every frame pulsing with tension.

Cinematography captures Karachi's gritty alleys in mesmerizing detail, paired with a score that amplifies dread and triumph. Though pacing draws minor critique amid political undertones dividing audiences in India and Pakistan, the film's immersive world-building, strategic depth, and heart-pounding climactic twists make it 2025's box-office king, priming for Part 2. A gritty masterpiece that grips like a vice-unmissable for thrill-seekers.

Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar is not a film that asks for your patience, it demands your complete surrender. Clocking in at 214 minutes, this sprawling espionage thriller transforms what could have been an exhausting runtime into a gripping journey through the moral abyss of covert operations and underworld politics.

Must watch movie, we need to support these kind of movies the way we did for animal, kabir Singh. I have never seen such a raw movie and thanks to Aditya dhar for making this happened, both Ranveer and Akshay Khanna had outpaced in their roles üí•üí•. Thankyou director we want more movies like this,
Jai hindüôè

The movie is great. The plot is good and the cinematography is awesome, salute to the man who wrote it's screenplay. Acting of every actor is awesome specially Akshay Khanna's presence stole the show. And you will definitely hate the character of Arjun Rampal. Ranveer Singh's character is so well written and directed, I feels surreal.
